2127/** Given a string <b>s</b> containing some routerdescs, parse it and put the
2128 * routers into our directory.  If saved_location is SAVED_NOWHERE, the routers
2129 * are in response to a query to the network: cache them by adding them to
2130 * the journal.
2131 *
2132 * Return the number of routers actually added.
2133 *
2134 * If <b>requested_fingerprints</b> is provided, it must contain a list of
2135 * uppercased fingerprints.  Do not update any router whose
2136 * fingerprint is not on the list; after updating a router, remove its
2137 * fingerprint from the list.
2138 *
2139 * If <b>descriptor_digests</b> is non-zero, then the requested_fingerprints
2140 * are descriptor digests. Otherwise they are identity digests.
2141 */
2142int
2143router_load_routers_from_string(const char *s, const char *eos,
2144                                saved_location_t saved_location,
2145                                smartlist_t *requested_fingerprints,
2146                                int descriptor_digests,
2147                                const char *prepend_annotations)
2148{
2149  smartlist_t *routers = smartlist_new(), *changed = smartlist_new();
2150  char fp[HEX_DIGEST_LEN+1];
2151  const char *msg;
2152  int from_cache = (saved_location != SAVED_NOWHERE);
2153  int allow_annotations = (saved_location != SAVED_NOWHERE);
2154  int any_changed = 0;
2155  smartlist_t *invalid_digests = smartlist_new();
2156
2157  router_parse_list_from_string(&s, eos, routers, saved_location, 0,
2158                                allow_annotations, prepend_annotations,
2159                                invalid_digests);
2160
2161  routers_update_status_from_consensus_networkstatus(routers, !from_cache);
2162
2163  log_info(LD_DIR, "%d elements to add", smartlist_len(routers));
2164
2165  SMARTLIST_FOREACH_BEGIN(routers, routerinfo_t *, ri) {
2166    was_router_added_t r;
2167    char d[DIGEST_LEN];
2168    if (requested_fingerprints) {
2169      base16_encode(fp, sizeof(fp), descriptor_digests ?
2170                      ri->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest :
2171                      ri->cache_info.identity_digest,
2172                    DIGEST_LEN);
2173      if (smartlist_contains_string(requested_fingerprints, fp)) {
2174        smartlist_string_remove(requested_fingerprints, fp);
2175      } else {
2176        char *requested =
2177          smartlist_join_strings(requested_fingerprints," ",0,NULL);
2178        log_warn(LD_DIR,
2179                 "We received a router descriptor with a fingerprint (%s) "
2180                 "that we never requested. (We asked for: %s.) Dropping.",
2181                 fp, requested);
2182        tor_free(requested);
2183        routerinfo_free(ri);
2184        continue;
2185      }
2186    }
2187
2188    memcpy(d, ri->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest, DIGEST_LEN);
2189    r = router_add_to_routerlist(ri, &msg, from_cache, !from_cache);
2190    if (WRA_WAS_ADDED(r)) {
2191      any_changed++;
2192      smartlist_add(changed, ri);
2193      routerlist_descriptors_added(changed, from_cache);
2194      smartlist_clear(changed);
2195    } else if (WRA_NEVER_DOWNLOADABLE(r)) {
2196      download_status_t *dl_status;
2197      dl_status = router_get_dl_status_by_descriptor_digest(d);
2198      if (dl_status) {
2199        log_info(LD_GENERAL, "Marking router %s as never downloadable",
2200                 hex_str(d, DIGEST_LEN));
2201        download_status_mark_impossible(dl_status);
2202      }
2203    }
2204  } SMARTLIST_FOREACH_END(ri);
2205
2206  SMARTLIST_FOREACH_BEGIN(invalid_digests, const uint8_t *, bad_digest) {
2207    /* This digest is never going to be parseable. */
2208    base16_encode(fp, sizeof(fp), (char*)bad_digest, DIGEST_LEN);
2209    if (requested_fingerprints && descriptor_digests) {
2210      if (! smartlist_contains_string(requested_fingerprints, fp)) {
2211        /* But we didn't ask for it, so we should assume shennanegans. */
2212        continue;
2213      }
2214      smartlist_string_remove(requested_fingerprints, fp);
2215    }
2216    download_status_t *dls;
2217    dls = router_get_dl_status_by_descriptor_digest((char*)bad_digest);
2218    if (dls) {
2219      log_info(LD_GENERAL, "Marking router with descriptor %s as unparseable, "
2220               "and therefore undownloadable", fp);
2221      download_status_mark_impossible(dls);
2222    }
2223  } SMARTLIST_FOREACH_END(bad_digest);
2224  SMARTLIST_FOREACH(invalid_digests, uint8_t *, d, tor_free(d));
2225  smartlist_free(invalid_digests);
2226
2227  routerlist_assert_ok(routerlist);
2228
2229  if (any_changed)
2230    router_rebuild_store(0, &routerlist->desc_store);
2231
2232  smartlist_free(routers);
2233  smartlist_free(changed);
2234
2235  return any_changed;
2236}
2237
2238/** Parse one or more extrainfos from <b>s</b> (ending immediately before
2239 * <b>eos</b> if <b>eos</b> is present).  Other arguments are as for
2240 * router_load_routers_from_string(). */
2241void
2242router_load_extrainfo_from_string(const char *s, const char *eos,
2243                                  saved_location_t saved_location,
2244                                  smartlist_t *requested_fingerprints,
2245                                  int descriptor_digests)
2246{
2247  smartlist_t *extrainfo_list = smartlist_new();
2248  const char *msg;
2249  int from_cache = (saved_location != SAVED_NOWHERE);
2250  smartlist_t *invalid_digests = smartlist_new();
2251
2252  router_parse_list_from_string(&s, eos, extrainfo_list, saved_location, 1, 0,
2253                                NULL, invalid_digests);
2254
2255  log_info(LD_DIR, "%d elements to add", smartlist_len(extrainfo_list));
2256
2257  SMARTLIST_FOREACH_BEGIN(extrainfo_list, extrainfo_t *, ei) {
2258      uint8_t d[DIGEST_LEN];
2259      memcpy(d, ei->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest, DIGEST_LEN);
2260      was_router_added_t added =
2261        router_add_extrainfo_to_routerlist(ei, &msg, from_cache, !from_cache);
2262      if (WRA_WAS_ADDED(added) && requested_fingerprints) {
2263        char fp[HEX_DIGEST_LEN+1];
2264        base16_encode(fp, sizeof(fp), descriptor_digests ?
2265                        ei->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest :
2266                        ei->cache_info.identity_digest,
2267                      DIGEST_LEN);
2268        smartlist_string_remove(requested_fingerprints, fp);
2269        /* We silently let relays stuff us with extrainfos we didn't ask for,
2270         * so long as we would have wanted them anyway.  Since we always fetch
2271         * all the extrainfos we want, and we never actually act on them
2272         * inside Tor, this should be harmless. */
2273      } else if (WRA_NEVER_DOWNLOADABLE(added)) {
2274        signed_descriptor_t *sd = router_get_by_extrainfo_digest((char*)d);
2275        if (sd) {
2276          log_info(LD_GENERAL, "Marking extrainfo with descriptor %s as "
2277                   "unparseable, and therefore undownloadable",
2278                   hex_str((char*)d,DIGEST_LEN));
2279          download_status_mark_impossible(&sd->ei_dl_status);
2280        }
2281      }
2282  } SMARTLIST_FOREACH_END(ei);
2283
2284  SMARTLIST_FOREACH_BEGIN(invalid_digests, const uint8_t *, bad_digest) {
2285    /* This digest is never going to be parseable. */
2286    char fp[HEX_DIGEST_LEN+1];
2287    base16_encode(fp, sizeof(fp), (char*)bad_digest, DIGEST_LEN);
2288    if (requested_fingerprints) {
2289      if (! smartlist_contains_string(requested_fingerprints, fp)) {
2290        /* But we didn't ask for it, so we should assume shennanegans. */
2291        continue;
2292      }
2293      smartlist_string_remove(requested_fingerprints, fp);
2294    }
2295    signed_descriptor_t *sd =
2296      router_get_by_extrainfo_digest((char*)bad_digest);
2297    if (sd) {
2298      log_info(LD_GENERAL, "Marking extrainfo with descriptor %s as "
2299               "unparseable, and therefore undownloadable", fp);
2300      download_status_mark_impossible(&sd->ei_dl_status);
2301    }
2302  } SMARTLIST_FOREACH_END(bad_digest);
2303  SMARTLIST_FOREACH(invalid_digests, uint8_t *, d, tor_free(d));
2304  smartlist_free(invalid_digests);
2305
2306  routerlist_assert_ok(routerlist);
2307  router_rebuild_store(0, &router_get_routerlist()->extrainfo_store);
2308
2309  smartlist_free(extrainfo_list);
2310}
2311
2312/** Return true iff the latest ns-flavored consensus includes a descriptor
2313 * whose digest is that of <b>desc</b>. */
2314static int
2315signed_desc_digest_is_recognized(signed_descriptor_t *desc)
2316{
2317  const routerstatus_t *rs;
2318  networkstatus_t *consensus = networkstatus_get_latest_consensus_by_flavor(
2319                                                                      FLAV_NS);
2320
2321  if (consensus) {
2322    rs = networkstatus_vote_find_entry(consensus, desc->identity_digest);
2323    if (rs && tor_memeq(rs->descriptor_digest,
2324                      desc->signed_descriptor_digest, DIGEST_LEN))
2325      return 1;
2326  }
2327  return 0;
2328}

2363
2364/** For every current directory connection whose purpose is <b>purpose</b>,
2365 * and where the resource being downloaded begins with <b>prefix</b>, split
2366 * rest of the resource into base16 fingerprints (or base64 fingerprints if
2367 * purpose==DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_MICRODESC), decode them, and set the
2368 * corresponding elements of <b>result</b> to a nonzero value.
2369 */
2370void
2371list_pending_downloads(digestmap_t *result, digest256map_t *result256,
2372                       int purpose, const char *prefix)
2373{
2374  const size_t p_len = strlen(prefix);
2375  smartlist_t *tmp = smartlist_new();
2376  smartlist_t *conns = get_connection_array();
2377  int flags = DSR_HEX;
2378  if (purpose == DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_MICRODESC)
2379    flags = DSR_DIGEST256|DSR_BASE64;
2380
2381  tor_assert(result || result256);
2382
2383  SMARTLIST_FOREACH_BEGIN(conns, connection_t *, conn) {
2384    if (conn->type == CONN_TYPE_DIR &&
2385        conn->purpose == purpose &&
2386        !conn->marked_for_close) {
2387      const char *resource = TO_DIR_CONN(conn)->requested_resource;
2388      if (!strcmpstart(resource, prefix))
2389        dir_split_resource_into_fingerprints(resource + p_len,
2390                                             tmp, NULL, flags);
2391    }
2392  } SMARTLIST_FOREACH_END(conn);
2393
2394  if (result) {
2395    SMARTLIST_FOREACH(tmp, char *, d,
2396                    {
2397                      digestmap_set(result, d, (void*)1);
2398                      tor_free(d);
2399                    });
2400  } else if (result256) {
2401    SMARTLIST_FOREACH(tmp, uint8_t *, d,
2402                    {
2403                      digest256map_set(result256, d, (void*)1);
2404                      tor_free(d);
2405                    });
2406  }
2407  smartlist_free(tmp);
2408}
2409
2410/** For every router descriptor (or extra-info document if <b>extrainfo</b> is
2411 * true) we are currently downloading by descriptor digest, set result[d] to
2412 * (void*)1. */
2413static void
2414list_pending_descriptor_downloads(digestmap_t *result, int extrainfo)
2415{
2416  int purpose =
2417    extrainfo ? DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_EXTRAINFO : DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_SERVERDESC;
2418  list_pending_downloads(result, NULL, purpose, "d/");
2419}
2420
2421/** For every microdescriptor we are currently downloading by descriptor
2422 * digest, set result[d] to (void*)1.
2423 */
2424void
2425list_pending_microdesc_downloads(digest256map_t *result)
2426{
2427  list_pending_downloads(NULL, result, DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_MICRODESC, "d/");
2428}
2429
2430/** Launch downloads for all the descriptors whose digests or digests256
2431 * are listed as digests[i] for lo <= i < hi.  (Lo and hi may be out of
2432 * range.)  If <b>source</b> is given, download from <b>source</b>;
2433 * otherwise, download from an appropriate random directory server.
2434 */
2435MOCK_IMPL(STATIC void,
2436initiate_descriptor_downloads,(const routerstatus_t *source,
2437                               int purpose, smartlist_t *digests,
2438                               int lo, int hi, int pds_flags))
2439{
2440  char *resource, *cp;
2441  int digest_len, enc_digest_len;
2442  const char *sep;
2443  int b64_256;
2444  smartlist_t *tmp;
2445
2446  if (purpose == DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_MICRODESC) {
2447    /* Microdescriptors are downloaded by "-"-separated base64-encoded
2448     * 256-bit digests. */
2449    digest_len = DIGEST256_LEN;
2450    enc_digest_len = BASE64_DIGEST256_LEN + 1;
2451    sep = "-";
2452    b64_256 = 1;
2453  } else {
2454    digest_len = DIGEST_LEN;
2455    enc_digest_len = HEX_DIGEST_LEN + 1;
2456    sep = "+";
2457    b64_256 = 0;
2458  }
2459
2460  if (lo < 0)
2461    lo = 0;
2462  if (hi > smartlist_len(digests))
2463    hi = smartlist_len(digests);
2464
2465  if (hi-lo <= 0)
2466    return;
2467
2468  tmp = smartlist_new();
2469
2470  for (; lo < hi; ++lo) {
2471    cp = tor_malloc(enc_digest_len);
2472    if (b64_256) {
2473      digest256_to_base64(cp, smartlist_get(digests, lo));
2474    } else {
2475      base16_encode(cp, enc_digest_len, smartlist_get(digests, lo),
2476                    digest_len);
2477    }
2478    smartlist_add(tmp, cp);
2479  }
2480
2481  cp = smartlist_join_strings(tmp, sep, 0, NULL);
2482  tor_asprintf(&resource, "d/%s.z", cp);
2483
2484  SMARTLIST_FOREACH(tmp, char *, cp1, tor_free(cp1));
2485  smartlist_free(tmp);
2486  tor_free(cp);
2487
2488  if (source) {
2489    /* We know which authority or directory mirror we want. */
2490    directory_request_t *req = directory_request_new(purpose);
2491    directory_request_set_routerstatus(req, source);
2492    directory_request_set_resource(req, resource);
2493    directory_initiate_request(req);
2494    directory_request_free(req);
2495  } else {
2496    directory_get_from_dirserver(purpose, ROUTER_PURPOSE_GENERAL, resource,
2497                                 pds_flags, DL_WANT_ANY_DIRSERVER);
2498  }
2499  tor_free(resource);
2500}
2501
2502/** Return the max number of hashes to put in a URL for a given request.
2503 */
2504static int
2505max_dl_per_request(const or_options_t *options, int purpose)
2506{
2507  /* Since squid does not like URLs >= 4096 bytes we limit it to 96.
2508   *   4096 - strlen(http://[ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff]:65535
2509   *                 /tor/server/d/.z) == 4026
2510   *   4026/41 (40 for the hash and 1 for the + that separates them) => 98
2511   *   So use 96 because it's a nice number.
2512   *
2513   * For microdescriptors, the calculation is
2514   *   4096 - strlen(http://[ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff:ffff]:65535
2515   *                 /tor/micro/d/.z) == 4027
2516   *   4027/44 (43 for the hash and 1 for the - that separates them) => 91
2517   *   So use 90 because it's a nice number.
2518   */
2519  int max = 96;
2520  if (purpose == DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_MICRODESC) {
2521    max = 90;
2522  }
2523  /* If we're going to tunnel our connections, we can ask for a lot more
2524   * in a request. */
2525  if (dirclient_must_use_begindir(options)) {
2526    max = 500;
2527  }
2528  return max;
2529}
2530
2531/** Don't split our requests so finely that we are requesting fewer than
2532 * this number per server. (Grouping more than this at once leads to
2533 * diminishing returns.) */
2534#define MIN_DL_PER_REQUEST 32
2535/** To prevent a single screwy cache from confusing us by selective reply,
2536 * try to split our requests into at least this many requests. */
2537#define MIN_REQUESTS 3
2538/** If we want fewer than this many descriptors, wait until we
2539 * want more, or until TestingClientMaxIntervalWithoutRequest has passed. */
2540#define MAX_DL_TO_DELAY 16
2541
2542/** Given a <b>purpose</b> (FETCH_MICRODESC or FETCH_SERVERDESC) and a list of
2543 * router descriptor digests or microdescriptor digest256s in
2544 * <b>downloadable</b>, decide whether to delay fetching until we have more.
2545 * If we don't want to delay, launch one or more requests to the appropriate
2546 * directory authorities.
2547 */
2548void
2549launch_descriptor_downloads(int purpose,
2550                            smartlist_t *downloadable,
2551                            const routerstatus_t *source, time_t now)
2552{
2553  const or_options_t *options = get_options();
2554  const char *descname;
2555  const int fetch_microdesc = (purpose == DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_MICRODESC);
2556  int n_downloadable = smartlist_len(downloadable);
2557
2558  int i, n_per_request, max_dl_per_req;
2559  const char *req_plural = "", *rtr_plural = "";
2560  int pds_flags = PDS_RETRY_IF_NO_SERVERS;
2561
2562  tor_assert(fetch_microdesc || purpose == DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_SERVERDESC);
2563  descname = fetch_microdesc ? "microdesc" : "routerdesc";
2564
2565  if (!n_downloadable)
2566    return;
2567
2568  if (!dirclient_fetches_dir_info_early(options)) {
2569    if (n_downloadable >= MAX_DL_TO_DELAY) {
2570      log_debug(LD_DIR,
2571                "There are enough downloadable %ss to launch requests.",
2572                descname);
2573    } else if (! router_have_minimum_dir_info()) {
2574      log_debug(LD_DIR,
2575                "We are only missing %d %ss, but we'll fetch anyway, since "
2576                "we don't yet have enough directory info.",
2577                n_downloadable, descname);
2578    } else {
2579
2580      /* should delay */
2581      if ((last_descriptor_download_attempted +
2582          options->TestingClientMaxIntervalWithoutRequest) > now)
2583        return;
2584
2585      if (last_descriptor_download_attempted) {
2586        log_info(LD_DIR,
2587                 "There are not many downloadable %ss, but we've "
2588                 "been waiting long enough (%d seconds). Downloading.",
2589                 descname,
2590                 (int)(now-last_descriptor_download_attempted));
2591      } else {
2592        log_info(LD_DIR,
2593                 "There are not many downloadable %ss, but we haven't "
2594                 "tried downloading descriptors recently. Downloading.",
2595                 descname);
2596      }
2597    }
2598  }
2599
2600  if (!authdir_mode(options)) {
2601    /* If we wind up going to the authorities, we want to only open one
2602     * connection to each authority at a time, so that we don't overload
2603     * them.  We do this by setting PDS_NO_EXISTING_SERVERDESC_FETCH
2604     * regardless of whether we're a cache or not.
2605     *
2606     * Setting this flag can make initiate_descriptor_downloads() ignore
2607     * requests.  We need to make sure that we do in fact call
2608     * update_router_descriptor_downloads() later on, once the connections
2609     * have succeeded or failed.
2610     */
2611    pds_flags |= fetch_microdesc ?
2612      PDS_NO_EXISTING_MICRODESC_FETCH :
2613      PDS_NO_EXISTING_SERVERDESC_FETCH;
2614  }
2615
2616  n_per_request = CEIL_DIV(n_downloadable, MIN_REQUESTS);
2617  max_dl_per_req = max_dl_per_request(options, purpose);
2618
2619  if (n_per_request > max_dl_per_req)
2620    n_per_request = max_dl_per_req;
2621
2622  if (n_per_request < MIN_DL_PER_REQUEST) {
2623    n_per_request = MIN(MIN_DL_PER_REQUEST, n_downloadable);
2624  }
2625
2626  if (n_downloadable > n_per_request)
2627    req_plural = rtr_plural = "s";
2628  else if (n_downloadable > 1)
2629    rtr_plural = "s";
2630
2631  log_info(LD_DIR,
2632           "Launching %d request%s for %d %s%s, %d at a time",
2633           CEIL_DIV(n_downloadable, n_per_request), req_plural,
2634           n_downloadable, descname, rtr_plural, n_per_request);
2635  smartlist_sort_digests(downloadable);
2636  for (i=0; i < n_downloadable; i += n_per_request) {
2637    initiate_descriptor_downloads(source, purpose,
2638                                  downloadable, i, i+n_per_request,
2639                                  pds_flags);
2640  }
2641  last_descriptor_download_attempted = now;
2642}
2643
2644/** For any descriptor that we want that's currently listed in
2645 * <b>consensus</b>, download it as appropriate. */
2646void
2647update_consensus_router_descriptor_downloads(time_t now, int is_vote,
2648                                             networkstatus_t *consensus)
2649{
2650  const or_options_t *options = get_options();
2651  digestmap_t *map = NULL;
2652  smartlist_t *no_longer_old = smartlist_new();
2653  smartlist_t *downloadable = smartlist_new();
2654  routerstatus_t *source = NULL;
2655  int authdir = authdir_mode(options);
2656  int n_delayed=0, n_have=0, n_would_reject=0, n_wouldnt_use=0,
2657    n_inprogress=0, n_in_oldrouters=0;
2658
2659  if (dirclient_too_idle_to_fetch_descriptors(options, now))
2660    goto done;
2661  if (!consensus)
2662    goto done;
2663
2664  if (is_vote) {
2665    /* where's it from, so we know whom to ask for descriptors */
2666    dir_server_t *ds;
2667    networkstatus_voter_info_t *voter = smartlist_get(consensus->voters, 0);
2668    tor_assert(voter);
2669    ds = trusteddirserver_get_by_v3_auth_digest(voter->identity_digest);
2670    if (ds)
2671      source = &(ds->fake_status);
2672    else
2673      log_warn(LD_DIR, "couldn't lookup source from vote?");
2674  }
2675
2676  map = digestmap_new();
2677  list_pending_descriptor_downloads(map, 0);
2678  SMARTLIST_FOREACH_BEGIN(consensus->routerstatus_list, void *, rsp) {
2679      routerstatus_t *rs;
2680      vote_routerstatus_t *vrs;
2681      if (is_vote) {
2682        rs = &(((vote_routerstatus_t *)rsp)->status);
2683        vrs = rsp;
2684      } else {
2685        rs = rsp;
2686        vrs = NULL;
2687      }
2688      signed_descriptor_t *sd;
2689      if ((sd = router_get_by_descriptor_digest(rs->descriptor_digest))) {
2690        const routerinfo_t *ri;
2691        ++n_have;
2692        if (!(ri = router_get_by_id_digest(rs->identity_digest)) ||
2693            tor_memneq(ri->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest,
2694                   sd->signed_descriptor_digest, DIGEST_LEN)) {
2695          /* We have a descriptor with this digest, but either there is no
2696           * entry in routerlist with the same ID (!ri), or there is one,
2697           * but the identity digest differs (memneq).
2698           */
2699          smartlist_add(no_longer_old, sd);
2700          ++n_in_oldrouters; /* We have it in old_routers. */
2701        }
2702        continue; /* We have it already. */
2703      }
2704      if (digestmap_get(map, rs->descriptor_digest)) {
2705        ++n_inprogress;
2706        continue; /* We have an in-progress download. */
2707      }
2708      if (!download_status_is_ready(&rs->dl_status, now)) {
2709        ++n_delayed; /* Not ready for retry. */
2710        continue;
2711      }
2712      if (authdir && is_vote && dirserv_would_reject_router(rs, vrs)) {
2713        ++n_would_reject;
2714        continue; /* We would throw it out immediately. */
2715      }
2716      if (!we_want_to_fetch_flavor(options, consensus->flavor) &&
2717          !client_would_use_router(rs, now)) {
2718        ++n_wouldnt_use;
2719        continue; /* We would never use it ourself. */
2720      }
2721      if (is_vote && source) {
2722        char old_digest_buf[HEX_DIGEST_LEN+1];
2723        const char *old_digest = "none";
2724        const routerinfo_t *oldrouter;
2725        oldrouter = router_get_by_id_digest(rs->identity_digest);
2726        if (oldrouter) {
2727          base16_encode(old_digest_buf, sizeof(old_digest_buf),
2728                        oldrouter->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest,
2729                        DIGEST_LEN);
2730          old_digest = old_digest_buf;
2731        }
2732        log_info(LD_DIR, "Learned about %s (%s vs %s) from %s's vote (%s)",
2733                 routerstatus_describe(rs),
2734                 hex_str(rs->descriptor_digest, DIGEST_LEN),
2735                 old_digest,
2736                 source->nickname, oldrouter ? "known" : "unknown");
2737      }
2738      smartlist_add(downloadable, rs->descriptor_digest);
2739  } SMARTLIST_FOREACH_END(rsp);
2740
2741  if (!authdir_mode_v3(options)
2742      && smartlist_len(no_longer_old)) {
2743    routerlist_t *rl = router_get_routerlist();
2744    log_info(LD_DIR, "%d router descriptors listed in consensus are "
2745             "currently in old_routers; making them current.",
2746             smartlist_len(no_longer_old));
2747    SMARTLIST_FOREACH_BEGIN(no_longer_old, signed_descriptor_t *, sd) {
2748        const char *msg;
2749        was_router_added_t r;
2750        time_t tmp_cert_expiration_time;
2751        routerinfo_t *ri = routerlist_reparse_old(rl, sd);
2752        if (!ri) {
2753          log_warn(LD_BUG, "Failed to re-parse a router.");
2754          continue;
2755        }
2756        /* need to remember for below, since add_to_routerlist may free. */
2757        tmp_cert_expiration_time = ri->cert_expiration_time;
2758
2759        r = router_add_to_routerlist(ri, &msg, 1, 0);
2760        if (WRA_WAS_OUTDATED(r)) {
2761          log_warn(LD_DIR, "Couldn't add re-parsed router: %s. This isn't "
2762                   "usually a big deal, but you should make sure that your "
2763                   "clock and timezone are set correctly.",
2764                   msg?msg:"???");
2765          if (r == ROUTER_CERTS_EXPIRED) {
2766            char time_cons[ISO_TIME_LEN+1];
2767            char time_cert_expires[ISO_TIME_LEN+1];
2768            format_iso_time(time_cons, consensus->valid_after);
2769            format_iso_time(time_cert_expires, tmp_cert_expiration_time);
2770            log_warn(LD_DIR, "  (I'm looking at a consensus from %s; This "
2771                     "router's certificates began expiring at %s.)",
2772                     time_cons, time_cert_expires);
2773          }
2774        }
2775    } SMARTLIST_FOREACH_END(sd);
2776    routerlist_assert_ok(rl);
2777  }
2778
2779  log_info(LD_DIR,
2780           "%d router descriptors downloadable. %d delayed; %d present "
2781           "(%d of those were in old_routers); %d would_reject; "
2782           "%d wouldnt_use; %d in progress.",
2783           smartlist_len(downloadable), n_delayed, n_have, n_in_oldrouters,
2784           n_would_reject, n_wouldnt_use, n_inprogress);
2785
2786  launch_descriptor_downloads(DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_SERVERDESC,
2787                              downloadable, source, now);
2788
2789  digestmap_free(map, NULL);
2790 done:
2791  smartlist_free(downloadable);
2792  smartlist_free(no_longer_old);
2793}
2794
2795/** Launch downloads for router status as needed. */
2796void
2797update_router_descriptor_downloads(time_t now)
2798{
2799  const or_options_t *options = get_options();
2800  if (should_delay_dir_fetches(options, NULL))
2801    return;
2802  if (!we_fetch_router_descriptors(options))
2803    return;
2804
2805  update_consensus_router_descriptor_downloads(now, 0,
2806                  networkstatus_get_reasonably_live_consensus(now, FLAV_NS));
2807}
2808
2809/** Launch extrainfo downloads as needed. */
2810void
2811update_extrainfo_downloads(time_t now)
2812{
2813  const or_options_t *options = get_options();
2814  routerlist_t *rl;
2815  smartlist_t *wanted;
2816  digestmap_t *pending;
2817  int old_routers, i, max_dl_per_req;
2818  int n_no_ei = 0, n_pending = 0, n_have = 0, n_delay = 0, n_bogus[2] = {0,0};
2819  if (! options->DownloadExtraInfo)
2820    return;
2821  if (should_delay_dir_fetches(options, NULL))
2822    return;
2823  if (!router_have_minimum_dir_info())
2824    return;
2825
2826  pending = digestmap_new();
2827  list_pending_descriptor_downloads(pending, 1);
2828  rl = router_get_routerlist();
2829  wanted = smartlist_new();
2830  for (old_routers = 0; old_routers < 2; ++old_routers) {
2831    smartlist_t *lst = old_routers ? rl->old_routers : rl->routers;
2832    for (i = 0; i < smartlist_len(lst); ++i) {
2833      signed_descriptor_t *sd;
2834      char *d;
2835      if (old_routers)
2836        sd = smartlist_get(lst, i);
2837      else
2838        sd = &((routerinfo_t*)smartlist_get(lst, i))->cache_info;
2839      if (sd->is_extrainfo)
2840        continue; /* This should never happen. */
2841      if (old_routers && !router_get_by_id_digest(sd->identity_digest))
2842        continue; /* Couldn't check the signature if we got it. */
2843      if (sd->extrainfo_is_bogus)
2844        continue;
2845      d = sd->extra_info_digest;
2846      if (tor_digest_is_zero(d)) {
2847        ++n_no_ei;
2848        continue;
2849      }
2850      if (eimap_get(rl->extra_info_map, d)) {
2851        ++n_have;
2852        continue;
2853      }
2854      if (!download_status_is_ready(&sd->ei_dl_status, now)) {
2855        ++n_delay;
2856        continue;
2857      }
2858      if (digestmap_get(pending, d)) {
2859        ++n_pending;
2860        continue;
2861      }
2862
2863      const signed_descriptor_t *sd2 = router_get_by_extrainfo_digest(d);
2864      if (sd2 != sd) {
2865        if (sd2 != NULL) {
2866          char d1[HEX_DIGEST_LEN+1], d2[HEX_DIGEST_LEN+1];
2867          char d3[HEX_DIGEST_LEN+1], d4[HEX_DIGEST_LEN+1];
2868          base16_encode(d1, sizeof(d1), sd->identity_digest, DIGEST_LEN);
2869          base16_encode(d2, sizeof(d2), sd2->identity_digest, DIGEST_LEN);
2870          base16_encode(d3, sizeof(d3), d, DIGEST_LEN);
2871          base16_encode(d4, sizeof(d3), sd2->extra_info_digest, DIGEST_LEN);
2872
2873          log_info(LD_DIR, "Found an entry in %s with mismatched "
2874                   "router_get_by_extrainfo_digest() value. This has ID %s "
2875                   "but the entry in the map has ID %s. This has EI digest "
2876                   "%s and the entry in the map has EI digest %s.",
2877                   old_routers?"old_routers":"routers",
2878                   d1, d2, d3, d4);
2879        } else {
2880          char d1[HEX_DIGEST_LEN+1], d2[HEX_DIGEST_LEN+1];
2881          base16_encode(d1, sizeof(d1), sd->identity_digest, DIGEST_LEN);
2882          base16_encode(d2, sizeof(d2), d, DIGEST_LEN);
2883
2884          log_info(LD_DIR, "Found an entry in %s with NULL "
2885                   "router_get_by_extrainfo_digest() value. This has ID %s "
2886                   "and EI digest %s.",
2887                   old_routers?"old_routers":"routers",
2888                   d1, d2);
2889        }
2890        ++n_bogus[old_routers];
2891        continue;
2892      }
2893      smartlist_add(wanted, d);
2894    }
2895  }
2896  digestmap_free(pending, NULL);
2897
2898  log_info(LD_DIR, "Extrainfo download status: %d router with no ei, %d "
2899           "with present ei, %d delaying, %d pending, %d downloadable, %d "
2900           "bogus in routers, %d bogus in old_routers",
2901           n_no_ei, n_have, n_delay, n_pending, smartlist_len(wanted),
2902           n_bogus[0], n_bogus[1]);
2903
2904  smartlist_shuffle(wanted);
2905
2906  max_dl_per_req = max_dl_per_request(options, DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_EXTRAINFO);
2907  for (i = 0; i < smartlist_len(wanted); i += max_dl_per_req) {
2908    initiate_descriptor_downloads(NULL, DIR_PURPOSE_FETCH_EXTRAINFO,
2909                                  wanted, i, i+max_dl_per_req,
2910                PDS_RETRY_IF_NO_SERVERS|PDS_NO_EXISTING_SERVERDESC_FETCH);
2911  }
2912
2913  smartlist_free(wanted);
2914}
2915
2916/** Reset the consensus and extra-info download failure count on all routers.
2917 * When we get a new consensus,
2918 * routers_update_status_from_consensus_networkstatus() will reset the
2919 * download statuses on the descriptors in that consensus.
2920 */
2921void
2922router_reset_descriptor_download_failures(void)
2923{
2924  log_debug(LD_GENERAL,
2925            "In router_reset_descriptor_download_failures()");
2926
2927  networkstatus_reset_download_failures();
2928  last_descriptor_download_attempted = 0;
2929  if (!routerlist)
2930    return;
2931  /* We want to download *all* extra-info descriptors, not just those in
2932   * the consensus we currently have (or are about to have) */
2933  SMARTLIST_FOREACH(routerlist->routers, routerinfo_t *, ri,
2934  {
2935    download_status_reset(&ri->cache_info.ei_dl_status);
2936  });
2937  SMARTLIST_FOREACH(routerlist->old_routers, signed_descriptor_t *, sd,
2938  {
2939    download_status_reset(&sd->ei_dl_status);
2940  });
2941}
2942
2943/** Any changes in a router descriptor's publication time larger than this are
2944 * automatically non-cosmetic. */
2945#define ROUTER_MAX_COSMETIC_TIME_DIFFERENCE (2*60*60)
2946
2947/** We allow uptime to vary from how much it ought to be by this much. */
2948#define ROUTER_ALLOW_UPTIME_DRIFT (6*60*60)
2949
2950/** Return true iff the only differences between r1 and r2 are such that
2951 * would not cause a recent (post 0.1.1.6) dirserver to republish.
2952 */
2953int
2954router_differences_are_cosmetic(const routerinfo_t *r1, const routerinfo_t *r2)
2955{
2956  time_t r1pub, r2pub;
2957  time_t time_difference;
2958  tor_assert(r1 && r2);
2959
2960  /* r1 should be the one that was published first. */
2961  if (r1->cache_info.published_on > r2->cache_info.published_on) {
2962    const routerinfo_t *ri_tmp = r2;
2963    r2 = r1;
2964    r1 = ri_tmp;
2965  }
2966
2967  /* If any key fields differ, they're different. */
2968  if (!tor_addr_eq(&r1->ipv4_addr, &r2->ipv4_addr) ||
2969      strcasecmp(r1->nickname, r2->nickname) ||
2970      r1->ipv4_orport != r2->ipv4_orport ||
2971      !tor_addr_eq(&r1->ipv6_addr, &r2->ipv6_addr) ||
2972      r1->ipv6_orport != r2->ipv6_orport ||
2973      r1->ipv4_dirport != r2->ipv4_dirport ||
2974      r1->purpose != r2->purpose ||
2975      r1->onion_pkey_len != r2->onion_pkey_len ||
2976      !tor_memeq(r1->onion_pkey, r2->onion_pkey, r1->onion_pkey_len) ||
2977      !crypto_pk_eq_keys(r1->identity_pkey, r2->identity_pkey) ||
2978      strcasecmp(r1->platform, r2->platform) ||
2979      (r1->contact_info && !r2->contact_info) || /* contact_info is optional */
2980      (!r1->contact_info && r2->contact_info) ||
2981      (r1->contact_info && r2->contact_info &&
2982       strcasecmp(r1->contact_info, r2->contact_info)) ||
2983      r1->is_hibernating != r2->is_hibernating ||
2984      ! addr_policies_eq(r1->exit_policy, r2->exit_policy) ||
2985      (r1->supports_tunnelled_dir_requests !=
2986       r2->supports_tunnelled_dir_requests))
2987    return 0;
2988  if ((r1->declared_family == NULL) != (r2->declared_family == NULL))
2989    return 0;
2990  if (r1->declared_family && r2->declared_family) {
2991    int i, n;
2992    if (smartlist_len(r1->declared_family)!=smartlist_len(r2->declared_family))
2993      return 0;
2994    n = smartlist_len(r1->declared_family);
2995    for (i=0; i < n; ++i) {
2996      if (strcasecmp(smartlist_get(r1->declared_family, i),
2997                     smartlist_get(r2->declared_family, i)))
2998        return 0;
2999    }
3000  }
3001
3002  /* Did bandwidth change a lot? */
3003  if ((r1->bandwidthcapacity < r2->bandwidthcapacity/2) ||
3004      (r2->bandwidthcapacity < r1->bandwidthcapacity/2))
3005    return 0;
3006
3007  /* Did the bandwidthrate or bandwidthburst change? */
3008  if ((r1->bandwidthrate != r2->bandwidthrate) ||
3009      (r1->bandwidthburst != r2->bandwidthburst))
3010    return 0;
3011
3012  /* Has enough time passed between the publication times? */
3013  if (r1->cache_info.published_on + ROUTER_MAX_COSMETIC_TIME_DIFFERENCE
3014      < r2->cache_info.published_on)
3015    return 0;
3016
3017  /* Did uptime fail to increase by approximately the amount we would think,
3018   * give or take some slop? */
3019  r1pub = r1->cache_info.published_on;
3020  r2pub = r2->cache_info.published_on;
3021  time_difference = r2->uptime - (r1->uptime + (r2pub - r1pub));
3022  if (time_difference < 0)
3023    time_difference = - time_difference;
3024  if (time_difference > ROUTER_ALLOW_UPTIME_DRIFT &&
3025      time_difference > r1->uptime * .05 &&
3026      time_difference > r2->uptime * .05)
3027    return 0;
3028
3029  /* Otherwise, the difference is cosmetic. */
3030  return 1;
3031}
3032
3033/** Check whether <b>sd</b> describes a router descriptor compatible with the
3034 * extrainfo document <b>ei</b>.
3035 *
3036 * <b>identity_pkey</b> (which must also be provided) is RSA1024 identity key
3037 * for the router. We use it to check the signature of the extrainfo document,
3038 * if it has not already been checked.
3039 *
3040 * If no router is compatible with <b>ei</b>, <b>ei</b> should be
3041 * dropped.  Return 0 for "compatible", return 1 for "reject, and inform
3042 * whoever uploaded <b>ei</b>, and return -1 for "reject silently.".  If
3043 * <b>msg</b> is present, set *<b>msg</b> to a description of the
3044 * incompatibility (if any).
3045 *
3046 * Set the extrainfo_is_bogus field in <b>sd</b> if the digests matched
3047 * but the extrainfo was nonetheless incompatible.
3048 **/
3049int
3050routerinfo_incompatible_with_extrainfo(const crypto_pk_t *identity_pkey,
3051                                       extrainfo_t *ei,
3052                                       signed_descriptor_t *sd,
3053                                       const char **msg)
3054{
3055  int digest_matches, digest256_matches, r=1;
3056  tor_assert(identity_pkey);
3057  tor_assert(sd);
3058  tor_assert(ei);
3059
3060  if (ei->bad_sig) {
3061    if (msg) *msg = "Extrainfo signature was bad, or signed with wrong key.";
3062    return 1;
3063  }
3064
3065  digest_matches = tor_memeq(ei->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest,
3066                           sd->extra_info_digest, DIGEST_LEN);
3067  /* Set digest256_matches to 1 if the digest is correct, or if no
3068   * digest256 was in the ri. */
3069  digest256_matches = tor_memeq(ei->digest256,
3070                                sd->extra_info_digest256, DIGEST256_LEN);
3071  digest256_matches |=
3072    fast_mem_is_zero(sd->extra_info_digest256, DIGEST256_LEN);
3073
3074  /* The identity must match exactly to have been generated at the same time
3075   * by the same router. */
3076  if (tor_memneq(sd->identity_digest,
3077                 ei->cache_info.identity_digest,
3078                 DIGEST_LEN)) {
3079    if (msg) *msg = "Extrainfo nickname or identity did not match routerinfo";
3080    goto err; /* different servers */
3081  }
3082
3083  if (! tor_cert_opt_eq(sd->signing_key_cert,
3084                        ei->cache_info.signing_key_cert)) {
3085    if (msg) *msg = "Extrainfo signing key cert didn't match routerinfo";
3086    goto err; /* different servers */
3087  }
3088
3089  if (ei->pending_sig) {
3090    char signed_digest[128];
3091    if (crypto_pk_public_checksig(identity_pkey,
3092                       signed_digest, sizeof(signed_digest),
3093                       ei->pending_sig, ei->pending_sig_len) != DIGEST_LEN ||
3094        tor_memneq(signed_digest, ei->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest,
3095               DIGEST_LEN)) {
3096      ei->bad_sig = 1;
3097      tor_free(ei->pending_sig);
3098      if (msg) *msg = "Extrainfo signature bad, or signed with wrong key";
3099      goto err; /* Bad signature, or no match. */
3100    }
3101
3102    ei->cache_info.send_unencrypted = sd->send_unencrypted;
3103    tor_free(ei->pending_sig);
3104  }
3105
3106  if (ei->cache_info.published_on < sd->published_on) {
3107    if (msg) *msg = "Extrainfo published time did not match routerdesc";
3108    goto err;
3109  } else if (ei->cache_info.published_on > sd->published_on) {
3110    if (msg) *msg = "Extrainfo published time did not match routerdesc";
3111    r = -1;
3112    goto err;
3113  }
3114
3115  if (!digest256_matches && !digest_matches) {
3116    if (msg) *msg = "Neither digest256 or digest matched "
3117               "digest from routerdesc";
3118    goto err;
3119  }
3120
3121  if (!digest256_matches) {
3122    if (msg) *msg = "Extrainfo digest did not match digest256 from routerdesc";
3123    goto err; /* Digest doesn't match declared value. */
3124  }
3125
3126  if (!digest_matches) {
3127    if (msg) *msg = "Extrainfo digest did not match value from routerdesc";
3128    goto err; /* Digest doesn't match declared value. */
3129  }
3130
3131  return 0;
3132 err:
3133  if (digest_matches) {
3134    /* This signature was okay, and the digest was right: This is indeed the
3135     * corresponding extrainfo.  But insanely, it doesn't match the routerinfo
3136     * that lists it.  Don't try to fetch this one again. */
3137    sd->extrainfo_is_bogus = 1;
3138  }
3139
3140  return r;
3141}
3142
3143/* Does ri have a valid ntor onion key?
3144 * Valid ntor onion keys exist and have at least one non-zero byte. */
3145int
3146routerinfo_has_curve25519_onion_key(const routerinfo_t *ri)
3147{
3148  if (!ri) {
3149    return 0;
3150  }
3151
3152  if (!ri->onion_curve25519_pkey) {
3153    return 0;
3154  }
3155
3156  if (fast_mem_is_zero((const char*)ri->onion_curve25519_pkey->public_key,
3157                      CURVE25519_PUBKEY_LEN)) {
3158    return 0;
3159  }
3160
3161  return 1;
3162}
3163
3164/* Is rs running a tor version known to support EXTEND2 cells?
3165 * If allow_unknown_versions is true, return true if we can't tell
3166 * (from a versions line or a protocols line) whether it supports extend2
3167 * cells.
3168 * Otherwise, return false if the version is unknown. */
3169int
3170routerstatus_version_supports_extend2_cells(const routerstatus_t *rs,
3171                                            int allow_unknown_versions)
3172{
3173  if (!rs) {
3174    return allow_unknown_versions;
3175  }
3176
3177  if (!rs->pv.protocols_known) {
3178    return allow_unknown_versions;
3179  }
3180
3181  return rs->pv.supports_extend2_cells;
3182}

3184/** Assert that the internal representation of <b>rl</b> is
3185 * self-consistent. */
3186void
3187routerlist_assert_ok(const routerlist_t *rl)
3188{
3189  routerinfo_t *r2;
3190  signed_descriptor_t *sd2;
3191  if (!rl)
3192    return;
3193  SMARTLIST_FOREACH_BEGIN(rl->routers, routerinfo_t *, r) {
3194    r2 = rimap_get(rl->identity_map, r->cache_info.identity_digest);
3195    tor_assert(r == r2);
3196    sd2 = sdmap_get(rl->desc_digest_map,
3197                    r->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest);
3198    tor_assert(&(r->cache_info) == sd2);
3199    tor_assert(r->cache_info.routerlist_index == r_sl_idx);
3200    /* XXXX
3201     *
3202     *   Hoo boy.  We need to fix this one, and the fix is a bit tricky, so
3203     * commenting this out is just a band-aid.
3204     *
3205     *   The problem is that, although well-behaved router descriptors
3206     * should never have the same value for their extra_info_digest, it's
3207     * possible for ill-behaved routers to claim whatever they like there.
3208     *
3209     *   The real answer is to trash desc_by_eid_map and instead have
3210     * something that indicates for a given extra-info digest we want,
3211     * what its download status is.  We'll do that as a part of routerlist
3212     * refactoring once consensus directories are in.  For now,
3213     * this rep violation is probably harmless: an adversary can make us
3214     * reset our retry count for an extrainfo, but that's not the end
3215     * of the world.  Changing the representation in 0.2.0.x would just
3216     * destabilize the codebase.
3217    if (!tor_digest_is_zero(r->cache_info.extra_info_digest)) {
3218      signed_descriptor_t *sd3 =
3219        sdmap_get(rl->desc_by_eid_map, r->cache_info.extra_info_digest);
3220      tor_assert(sd3 == &(r->cache_info));
3221    }
3222    */
3223  } SMARTLIST_FOREACH_END(r);
3224  SMARTLIST_FOREACH_BEGIN(rl->old_routers, signed_descriptor_t *, sd) {
3225    r2 = rimap_get(rl->identity_map, sd->identity_digest);
3226    tor_assert(!r2 || sd != &(r2->cache_info));
3227    sd2 = sdmap_get(rl->desc_digest_map, sd->signed_descriptor_digest);
3228    tor_assert(sd == sd2);
3229    tor_assert(sd->routerlist_index == sd_sl_idx);
3230    /* XXXX see above.
3231    if (!tor_digest_is_zero(sd->extra_info_digest)) {
3232      signed_descriptor_t *sd3 =
3233        sdmap_get(rl->desc_by_eid_map, sd->extra_info_digest);
3234      tor_assert(sd3 == sd);
3235    }
3236    */
3237  } SMARTLIST_FOREACH_END(sd);
3238
3239  RIMAP_FOREACH(rl->identity_map, d, r) {
3240    tor_assert(tor_memeq(r->cache_info.identity_digest, d, DIGEST_LEN));
3241  } DIGESTMAP_FOREACH_END;
3242  SDMAP_FOREACH(rl->desc_digest_map, d, sd) {
3243    tor_assert(tor_memeq(sd->signed_descriptor_digest, d, DIGEST_LEN));
3244  } DIGESTMAP_FOREACH_END;
3245  SDMAP_FOREACH(rl->desc_by_eid_map, d, sd) {
3246    tor_assert(!tor_digest_is_zero(d));
3247    tor_assert(sd);
3248    tor_assert(tor_memeq(sd->extra_info_digest, d, DIGEST_LEN));
3249  } DIGESTMAP_FOREACH_END;
3250  EIMAP_FOREACH(rl->extra_info_map, d, ei) {
3251    signed_descriptor_t *sd;
3252    tor_assert(tor_memeq(ei->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest,
3253                       d, DIGEST_LEN));
3254    sd = sdmap_get(rl->desc_by_eid_map,
3255                   ei->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest);
3256    // tor_assert(sd); // XXXX see above
3257    if (sd) {
3258      tor_assert(tor_memeq(ei->cache_info.signed_descriptor_digest,
3259                         sd->extra_info_digest, DIGEST_LEN));
3260    }
3261  } DIGESTMAP_FOREACH_END;
3262}

3264/** Allocate and return a new string representing the contact info
3265 * and platform string for <b>router</b>,
3266 * surrounded by quotes and using standard C escapes.
3267 *
3268 * THIS FUNCTION IS NOT REENTRANT.  Don't call it from outside the main
3269 * thread.  Also, each call invalidates the last-returned value, so don't
3270 * try log_warn(LD_GENERAL, "%s %s", esc_router_info(a), esc_router_info(b));
3271 *
3272 * If <b>router</b> is NULL, it just frees its internal memory and returns.
3273 */
3274const char *
3275esc_router_info(const routerinfo_t *router)
3276{
3277  static char *info=NULL;
3278  char *esc_contact, *esc_platform;
3279  tor_free(info);
3280
3281  if (!router)
3282    return NULL; /* we're exiting; just free the memory we use */
3283
3284  esc_contact = esc_for_log(router->contact_info);
3285  esc_platform = esc_for_log(router->platform);
3286
3287  tor_asprintf(&info, "Contact %s, Platform %s", esc_contact, esc_platform);
3288  tor_free(esc_contact);
3289  tor_free(esc_platform);
3290
3291  return info;
3292}

3294/** Helper for sorting: compare two routerinfos by their identity
3295 * digest. */
3296static int
3297compare_routerinfo_by_id_digest_(const void **a, const void **b)
3298{
3299  routerinfo_t *first = *(routerinfo_t **)a, *second = *(routerinfo_t **)b;
3300  return fast_memcmp(first->cache_info.identity_digest,
3301                second->cache_info.identity_digest,
3302                DIGEST_LEN);
3303}

3305/** Sort a list of routerinfo_t in ascending order of identity digest. */
3306void
3307routers_sort_by_identity(smartlist_t *routers)
3308{
3309  smartlist_sort(routers, compare_routerinfo_by_id_digest_);
3310}

3312/** Called when we change a node set, or when we reload the geoip IPv4 list:
3313 * recompute all country info in all configuration node sets and in the
3314 * routerlist. */
3315void
3316refresh_all_country_info(void)
3317{
3318  const or_options_t *options = get_options();
3319
3320  if (options->EntryNodes)
3321    routerset_refresh_countries(options->EntryNodes);
3322  if (options->ExitNodes)
3323    routerset_refresh_countries(options->ExitNodes);
3324  if (options->MiddleNodes)
3325    routerset_refresh_countries(options->MiddleNodes);
3326  if (options->ExcludeNodes)
3327    routerset_refresh_countries(options->ExcludeNodes);
3328  if (options->ExcludeExitNodes)
3329    routerset_refresh_countries(options->ExcludeExitNodes);
3330  if (options->ExcludeExitNodesUnion_)
3331    routerset_refresh_countries(options->ExcludeExitNodesUnion_);
3332
3333  nodelist_refresh_countries();
3334}
